intro: Collaea pascuorum, commonly known as the common grass-of-Parnassus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Collaea pascuorum is often found in rocky or meadow-like environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
